Class DatagramWanEmulator

java.lang.Object
  DatagramWanEmulator

public class DatagramWanEmulator
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class for debugging UDP communication. The DatagramWanEmulator sits between two specified DatagramSockets and introduces latency, jitter and package loss between these two sockets.

In order to use the emulator, you send the DatagramPackets directly to the emulator's SocketAddress instead of sending them to the receiver SocketAddress. The emulator will introduce latency, jitter and package loss. Then it will send the packets to the receiving socket.

This class can be instantiated with the respective addresses. Use the appropriate methods to start and stop the emulation. The specific emulation parameters can be tuned with the appropriate getters / setters.

Author:
mucaho

Constructor Detail

DatagramWanEmulator

public DatagramWanEmulator(java.net.InetSocketAddress emulatorAddress,
                           java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddressA)
                    throws java.net.SocketException
Construct a new DatagramWanEmulator. This will automatically create a new socket bound to the specified emulatorAddress. The socketAddressB will be captured the first time a packet is sent from socketAddressB.

Parameters:
emulatorAddress - the emulator address
socketAddressA - one socket address
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - the socket exception

DatagramWanEmulator

public DatagramWanEmulator(java.net.InetSocketAddress emulatorAddress,
                           java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddressA,
                           java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddressB)
                    throws java.net.SocketException
Construct a new DatagramWanEmulator. This will automatically create a new socket bound to the specified emulatorAddress.

Parameters:
emulatorAddress - the emulator address
socketAddressA - one socket address
socketAddressB - the other socket address
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - the socket exception

getMaxPacketLength

public int getMaxPacketLength()
Gets the maximum size of incoming / outcoming datagram packets (in bytes). Defaults to 1024.

Returns:
the max packet length

setMaxPacketLength

public void setMaxPacketLength(int maxPacketLength)
Sets the maximum size of incoming / outcoming datagram packets (in bytes). Defaults to 1024.

Parameters:
maxPacketLength - the new max packet length

getPackageLoss

public float getPackageLoss()
Gets the amount of package loss. A value of 0.0f means no package loss, a value of 1.0f means every packet will be lost. Defaults to 0.1f (== 10%).

Returns:
the package loss percentage

setPackageLoss

public void setPackageLoss(float percentage)
Sets the amount of package loss. A value of 0.0f means no package loss, a value of 1.0f means every packet will be lost. Defaults to 0.1f (== 10%).

Parameters:
percentage - the new package loss percentage

getPackageDuplication

public float getPackageDuplication()
Gets the chance of a packet being duplicated. A value of 0.0f means no packets will be duplicated, a value of 1.0f means every packet will be duplicated infinitely. Defaults to 0.03f (3%).

setPackageDuplication

public void setPackageDuplication(float packageDuplication)
Sets the chance of a packet being duplicated. A value of 0.0f means no packets will be duplicated, a value of 1.0f means every packet will be duplicated infinitely. Defaults to 0.03f (3%).

getMaxLatency

public int getMaxLatency()
Gets the maximum latency between sending from one host to receiving on the other one. The latency will vary between minLatency and maxLatency. Defaults to 250 ms.

Returns:
the max latency

setMaxLatency

public void setMaxLatency(int maxLatency)
Sets the maximum latency between sending from one host to receiving on the other one. The latency will vary between minLatency and maxLatency. Defaults to 250 ms.

Parameters:
maxLatency - the new max latency

getMinLatency

public int getMinLatency()
Gets the minimum latency between sending from one host to receiving on the other one. The latency will vary between minLatency and maxLatency. Defaults to 100 ms.

Returns:
the min latency

setMinLatency

public void setMinLatency(int minLatency)
Sets the minimum latency between sending from one host to receiving on the other one. The latency will vary between minLatency and maxLatency. Defaults to 100 ms.

Parameters:
minLatency - the new min latency

startEmulation

public void startEmulation()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Start the emulation between the two sockets.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current instance has already been stopped by stopEmulation(). Create new instance instead.

stopEmulation

public void stopEmulation()
Let the emulation end and close the associated emulator socket.
